description.narrative: By 2018, 60% of heath facilities provide an integrated care package for child survival in at least 5 provinces

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, 60% of heath facilities provide an integrated care package for child survival in at least 5 provinces

description.narrative: UNICEF Burundi provided technical and financial support for the implementation of high-impact interventions for child survival in health facilities and at community level. As a result, about 650,000 children under five were assisted in 2018 and 43,000 were treated for severe acute malnutrition. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Proportion of domestic resources in paying for all the traditional vaccines (BCG, Measles and TT)
Number of stockouts of ORS at the national level
Percentage of districts providing care for children with SAM as part of regular health and nutrition services
Number of Sphere standards met (in relation to the management of SAM)
Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
Number of community health workers that underwent skills enhancement programmes to operationalize integrated community case management (iCCM) through UNICEF-supported programmes
Country has introduced PCV in its national immunization schedule
